result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Per the Attorney General Nathaniel Adamson - remove the GPS condition of bond, but the no contact with Victim stays in place. 
Court approves the GPS condition be removed. Court states to defendant that there is to be absolute no contact with Victim.

Prosecuting attorney Nathaniel E Adamson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Alan Gunn in court, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug in court for Benjamin Alan Gunn. Defendant address bond. Defendant requesting a bond reduction.  State opposes bail reduction but does state would like the GPS removed from the condition but the no contact with victim remains in place. Court removes the GPS but is denying any bond reduction. Bond will continue at $25,000 cash and absolute no contact with victim.

Prosecuting attorney Nathaniel E Adamson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Benjamin Alan Gunn in court, in custody at Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Chad M Fahrenkrug in court for Benjamin Alan Gunn. 
Attorney Fahrenkrug filed a motion to withdrawal as counsel. Defendant would like Attorney to withdrawal. State takes no position. Court approves the withdrawal. Per the Courts will wait to do the preliminary hearing until new counsel is appointed to defendant.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
(Correspondence from K. Rarmirez to court)
And Transport (defendant from DCI on 8/15 to Br #7 courtroom for Preliminary Hearing)
